description:
If you’re looking for a step up from the Optimo 4, but don’t need the 10-speed drivetrain of the Optimo 2, the Optimo 3 is your bike. Built on the race tested Optimo frame, the CAAD Optimo 3 lets you battle with the pack on weekend club rides and makes your daily commute a bit more enjoyable. The proven frame delivers the same geometry and handling of a high-end road bike, while saving you some money for kit. Outfitted with an 18-speed Sora drivetrain, you get Shimano reliability, without the higher cost of top-end groupsets. And the dual pivot Promax brakes, keep the potential speed of your new road bike right where you want it.

  • Smartform C2 alloy frame with a carbon blade fork and performance cyclocross geometry
  • Shimano Sora groupset with FSA Vero cranks
  • Promax RC-452 dual pivot caliper brakes offer reliable stopping power
  • 2x9 drivetrain pairs 50-34T chain rings with an 11-30T cassette
  • SAVE™ Micro-suspension uses strategically engineered flex zones in the rear triangle to smooth out the ride
  • Subtle rack and Fender mounts in the rear triangle
  • Vittoria Zaffiro tires have confidence inspiring traction and a smooth roll
  • Bikes are covered by MEC's Rocksolid Guarantee and Bike Service Agreement. You can bring your bike to any MEC bike shop for free adjustments and minor maintenance for two years after purchase
  • Due to challenges with supply chain, components may be substituted for comparable parts at any time. The listed build is how MEC intended your bike to arrive, though the manufacturer may need to make a tweak or two to get you riding sooner
